title: Drawing, Design for Corner Parlor Cabinet of Mahogany, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for Corner Parlor Cabinet of Mahogany
medium: Pen and black ink on thin cream paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, center of design, with arrow pointing to glass doors: Three glass shelves in cupboard; at lower right corner of sheet: Corner Parlor Cabinet / of Mahogany / 125.00 [in graphite]
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Triangular-shaped cabinet with canted corners; raised on 3 short, tapering legs; glass front door and 3 inside shelves; pieces of china suggested on shelves inside cabinet; backsplash.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Corner Parlor Cabinet of Mahogany, 1900–05. Pen and black ink on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-220
